page.title: 15Population of Twyford Area
page.content: The population is 100% English -speaking,1 or 2 % are not English by birth and English is not their native tongue.The farmers are mostly local - born people.As with most villages the population is growing due to the building of new houses and renovation of older properties.The newcomers come from all parts of Britain.Different social groups are not very noticable. About 5 properties are occupied by people well above working-class status.There are more than average one-person households.Mainly old local people who are often helped in the upkeep of their own home by good neighbours and the village community. When local people die they are usually buried in the village graveyard or cremated and have a small memorial in the Churchyard.
